content.description: DOES NOT HAVE BOLTS TO THE TOP!  I give it a bomb rating as a warning that it is an incomplete route but as far as a Project,  I would give it 3 stars because the rock quality is really good and its position on the cliff is nice.  I wish I had the kung pow to do it! I put in the TR anchors a long time ago and was unable to make it through the dark orange rock 2/3rd up the route. Since then, there has been 4 bolts added by someone else to the bottom half of the climb but I am guessing they also were unable to get it to go to the cold shuts.  Hopefully one of you honers out there can finish it. I put 5.12 on there because MP makes me pick a grade.  It could be 5.13 for all I know.
content.protection: Cold Shuts at the top - 4 bolts to the mid way point
content.location: Right up the sheerest orange rock in the center of the cliff.  Bolts end mid way.

content.description: I have never climbed this one and I am guessing on the grade.  I do remember Aaron and Matt telling me that it was a little easier than Git You Some though. New chains are easily accessible now for a TR with a nifty safety bolt to protect the set up. Bring a cordelette or a long piece of webbing.
content.location: Left side of the wall.  The route finishes just to the right of the V shaped cleft in the upper bulbous dark section.  Don't confuse this route with the project to the right that doesn't have bolts to the top.

climbs.name: Grungy Hawaiian Creole
climbs.fa: TR FA Kyran Keisling - FA ?  - Bolted By?

content.description: I had done the TR on this a long time ago and really enjoyed the movement throughout, I especially liked the crux moves at 3/4 height.  It since has been bolted.  I am unsure if they were able to lead the rig.  If you know who bolted it/ lead it, I would love to give them credit. The route has chains on the lip that can be backed up by a protection bolt at the top but it is a bit off to the side.  A cordelette or long piece of webbing comes in handy.
content.protection: Bolts - Welded cold shuts - TRS Chains
content.location: Furthest right route on the wall.

content.description: Thin balancy climbing on good rock. A little run out in spots.  New chains are easily accessible now for a TRS with a nifty safety bolt to protect the set up. Bring a cordelette or a long piece of webbing for the back up.
content.location: The route closest to the obvious AKAAKA dihedral.

climbs.name: AKAAKAA - Also Known As a Kick Ass Arete

content.description:
The off width looks hideous but you don't ever have to go OW on it, you can pleasantly stem the whole thing @ 5.8 or you can climb the left side and eliminate the stemming for an arete type experience (hence the name) at 5.10-.  Easy access TRS anchors with a protection anchor at the top, a cordelette or a long piece of webbing comes in handy.   This route now has steel lowering carabiners.

PLEASE DON'T STEAL THEM!!
content.location: Obvious varnished left facing dihedral with a horrible looking off width crack in it.
